title: Amazon KDP Beginners Guide - Step by Step Tutorial / Part 1 - Keyword Research

tactics.name: Amazon Auto Suggestions
tactics.description: Use Amazon's auto-suggestions to identify high-demand keywords by typing broad terms followed by a letter and analyzing the generated suggestions.
steps: Type broad terms like 'books for kids' followed by a letter
Use Amazon suggestion expander to capture additional keywords
Enter keywords into a spreadsheet for later analysis
caveats: Disregard competition initially as focus is on relevance and quality
source_quotes: most profitable keywords already have a lot of competition

tactics.name: Bestseller List Analysis
tactics.description: Leverage Amazon's bestseller lists to identify trending keywords within specific niches.
steps: Search Amazon's bestseller list on Google
Navigate to relevant categories (e.g., children's books)
source_quotes: I don't look for keywords here [in bestseller lists]

tactics.name: Subcategory Keyword Scanning
tactics.description: Search for keywords in subcategories with low review counts and high demand signals
steps: Identify newly published books with <150 reviews
source_quotes: I look for two things here firstly newly published books with few reviews of 150 or less and a BSR of 50,000 or less

tactics.name: prioritize_keywords
tactics.description: Use set results for keyword prioritization but avoid over-reliance on competitor counts due to irrelevant book matches
steps: Analyze set results for keyword relevance
Focus on keywords with lower competitor counts but relevant content matches
caveats: Set results may include unrelated physical items or books with no competitive overlap
source_quotes: the truth is you might overlook some valuable keywords just because you think they have 10,000 competitors

heuristics.name: Low Competition Focus
heuristics.condition: If keywords have low review counts, prioritize them for differentiation
source_quotes: most profitable keywords already have a lot of competition

heuristics.name: Keyword Competition Check
heuristics.condition: If multiple books share the same keyword with low reviews, prioritize
source_quotes: I seek out keywords that have appeared multiple times on the list this suggest that the keyword might be in demand

heuristics.name: boost_high_value_keywords
heuristics.condition: If a keyword has low review counts but high relevance, prioritize content creation
source_quotes: focus on that keyword and make other contents around it

claims.statement: Authors can achieve 6,800+ sales in 6 months in competitive niches through strategic keyword research.
source_quotes: sold over 6,800 paperback copies within 6 months

claims.statement: Amazon's BSR metric correlates with sales volume
source_quotes: Amazon's bestseller rank is a metric that indicates how a product is selling in the Amazon store compared to other products listed in the same category

claims.statement: Establishing brand authority reduces ad expenses by increasing brand recognition
source_quotes: reduce ad expenses because most of the people seeing your ads will recognize your brand

niche_patterns.description: Target niche audiences with specific age ranges and needs to improve search visibility
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Aligns with Amazon's algorithm prioritization of targeted, relevant keywords
